reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here from March 18 - March 24th. We checked in pretty late and the office was very helpful in making sure we got our keys to check into our unit. Our until had three bedrooms and the kitchen facilities were excellent. You just don't know sometimes esp. when you trade a unit and it lists all these amenities but when when you show up it's not as it says. The unit was beautiful and the airconditioning and fans worked. We visited the Great Barrier Reef (the front desk book the tour for us), the Kuranda Gardens (held a koala) and drove to the beach (which we definitely recommend Palm Cove beach). We definitely recommend Palm Cove area. It's got some beautiful hotels that we wished someone would have told us about that is not far from Cairns. The beaches in Cairns aren't really swimming beaches but Palm Cove is. It's a very pretty town. We drove down to Mission Beach which was hit by a hurricane before we went so the beaches and trees were damaged unfortunately. There are computers that you can pay per use in the reception area and a ton of brochures on activities you can review before booking.
reviews.title: Great place to stay & base for daily excursions

reviews.text: We recently stayed at Trinity Links Resort (Sept 2010) and were very happy with the resort. It's a little out of the way from other resorts however the room, pool and staff were excellent.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay, great pools!

reviews.text: Trinity links Apartments have some rooms owned by Wyndham. I gather most of the rest are privately owned. It is nice and quiet, we did not see much of any residents except on arrival we asked one where the office was. But apparently he did not speak English.
reviews.title: Wyndham - Ok, as long as you have everything working.

reviews.text: Check in was ok, after we found where it was. It was a long day and we were all tired. The instructions and the map to our room was a good idea, but the lady behind the counter did not write very clearly on the map and we went to the wrong room (did not find this out until much later and we had to move.) It looked like 116 on the map, yet we were in something like 115. I shall see if I can attach the photo.
reviews.title: Great stay, excellent service.

reviews.text: Then, the room we had, the washing machine did not work and the air conditioner was down for a day or so. It took a couple of days to get the washing machine fixed so this put a dampener on our holiday. As with most Wyndham places I have been, it is quite out of the way. You really need a car to get into Cairns as it is way to far to walk, not sure how regular the public transport is, but it is a good 5 min or so drive into the main part of Cairns. It would have been nice to stay somewhere closer to the amenities/shops/grocery stores.
reviews.title: Out of town, great pools, big units

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After 2 years of hard saving and budgeting my partner and i were so excited about booking our holiday in Cairns, staying at Trinity Links Resort. Regardless of the amount of research we did, nothing could come close to what we experienced during our stay.
reviews.title: Absolute Disaster
Home away from home
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived in Cairns, bells started ringing as to what a mistake we have made. On phoning the resort, when we arrived at Cairns Airport, i was greeted to a cheery greeting from Melissa on the telephone. I asked her if the resort offered an airport pick up service only for her attitude to take a full turnaround. She quickly replied by asking if i knew what the cost of operating airport transfers would be if she offered such a service and then went on, without being asked, to tell me where where i had to walk in order to catch a taxi, before she promptly hung up the phone.
